sections.1_story: Imagine you are tossing a coin to decide who goes first in a game. Probability helps you measure the chance of getting heads or tails, making it a powerful tool for predicting outcomes in uncertain situations.

4_micro_examples: Probability of getting a head in a coin toss = 1/2.
Probability of rolling a 3 on a die = 1/6.
Probability of drawing an ace from a deck = 4/52 = 1/13.
Probability of getting an even number on a die = 3/6 = 1/2.
Probability of not getting a head in a coin toss = 1 - 1/2 = 1/2.
